key_points: Vice President Kamala Harris became the first sitting Vice President to march in a Pride event.
Participated in Capital Pride in Washington, D.C. with Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff.
Wore a "love is love" t-shirt and spoke briefly at an event, advocating for the Equality Act.
Expressed commitment to advancing LGBTQ rights, specifically mentioning protection for the transgender community and youth.
Commemorated the fifth anniversary of the Pulse Nightclub shooting on Twitter, honoring the 49 people killed.
Highlighted the Biden Administration's pledge to build a world free from gun violence.
President Biden announced he would sign legislation to make the Pulse Nightclub a national memorial.
Administration has prioritized LGBTQ issues, reversing several policies from the previous administration.
Biden's first executive orders included protections against discrimination based on gender identity or sexual orientation.
Pride Month is observed amid an uncertain time for the LGBTQ community, with a record number of anti-LGBTQ bills under consideration.
